translated: The meaning of that is, first, one should imagine the syllable A at the heart, and then, by the union of the three syllables, one should train in the light rays of five colors that arise from that and extend out to a distance of sixteen fingerbreadths.

original: yang na dus gsum sangs rgyas ni khrag dang chu dang byang chub sems kyi rtse ste bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dus gsum sangs rgyas ni khrag dang chu dang byang chub sems kyi rtse ste bsgom pa'o //
translated: Or else, the Buddhas of the three times are the tips of the blood, water, and bodhicitta channels, which are meditated upon.

original: de'i dbus kyi phyogs su thig le 'pho 'jug dang bcas pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi phyogs su thig le 'pho 'jug dang bcas pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
translated: In the middle of that, the movement of the drop is the vajra recitation.

original: ji lta bur bzlas she na /
analyzed: ji lta bur bzlas she na /
translated: How is it recited?

original: slob mo za zhing mi bzlas te //
analyzed: slob mo za zhing mi bzlas te //

original: zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan la bslang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa gzhan la bslang bar mi bya'o //
translated: This means that one should not request form, etc., from another.

original: ma bslangs pa la chags mi bya //
analyzed: ma bslangs pa la chags mi bya //
translated: One should not be attached to what is not requested.

original: zhes pa ni rang ri rdzas rnams la'ang chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang ri rdzas rnams la'ang chags par mi bya'o //
translated: This means that one should not be attached to one's own substances.üîΩAs it is said elsewhere:

original: gzhan las / sems dpa' chen po sems can la la dag rang gi rdzas dang gzhan gyi rdzas la chags par byed pa ni rtag tu sdug bsngal gyi btson ra na gnas pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan las / sems dpa' chen po sems can la la dag rang gi rdzas dang gzhan gyi rdzas la chags par byed pa ni rtag tu sdug bsngal gyi btson ra na gnas pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Great being, some beings who are attached to their own substances and the substances of others always dwell in the prison of suffering.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing //
translated: One should enjoy all desires.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod par bya bas 'dod pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod par bya bas 'dod pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, desirable means desire, which is form, etc.

original: de la longs spyod pa ni de la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod pa ni de la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is the enjoyment of that.

original: de'i don yang @215b bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i skus /
analyzed: de'i don yang @215b bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i skus /
translated: The meaning of that is that by the body of the great seal of the stage of generation,

analyzed: gzugs kyi lha mo nas reg bya'i lha mo'i bar gyis mnyes par byed par bsam mo //

analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i don thob par byed par 'dod pa'o //

original: de la longs spyod ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yul du byas te bsgom pa ste de'i don ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa yi ge gsum gyi sbyor bas bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yul du byas te bsgom pa ste de'i don ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa yi ge gsum gyi sbyor bas bslab par bya'o //
translated: The enjoyment is the meditation by making it the object of samadhi. The meaning of that is that one should train in the application of the three syllables of arising, entering, and abiding.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i zhen pa bzlog par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i zhen pa bzlog par 'dod pa ste /

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rtsa kha bye ba'i steng du zla ba dang thig le gnas te rlung 'byung 'jug tshar bcad pa de'i tshe yul gyi rtog pa ldog par 'gyur ro //

translated: When the moon and drop abide on the opened channel of the one abiding in the object and so on, and the exhaled and inhaled breath are arrested, at that time the conception of an object will be averted.

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi yan lag gi grogs te /

analyzed: 'di ltar dam tshig dang shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin dang byang chub sems la sogs pa dang ldan par bzlas she'o //

analyzed: sems rnam par dag @216a * // pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /

analyzed: de'i phyir / bskyed pa'i rim pa dag shes nas // zhes pa ste /

original: phyi nas nang du 'dus pa ni lte ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas nang du 'dus pa ni lte ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Later, the outer dissolves into the inner. This is from the perspective of the navel.

original: yang na snying ga dang 'dra bas snying ga ste /
analyzed: yang na snying ga dang 'dra bas snying ga ste /
translated: Or, because it is similar to the heart, it is the heart.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor bsam pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor bsam pa ni man ngag go //
translated: The imagination in the wheel of great bliss is the esoteric instruction.

original: de ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the yoga of apprehending the whole.

original: rjes su gzhig pa'i dbang du bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su gzhig pa'i dbang du bya ba ni /
translated: The following is from the point of view of the subsequent dissolution.

original: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu nyid //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu nyid //
translated: The moving and the unmoving.

original: ces pa ni snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: ces pa ni snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: This refers to the world of the environment and the world of the inhabitants.

original: yang na rgyu ba ni rlung rgyu ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu ba ni rlung rgyu ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the moving is from the point of view of the moving winds.

original: mi rgyu ba ni khyab byed kyi rlung ngo //
analyzed: mi rgyu ba ni khyab byed kyi rlung ngo //
translated: The unmoving is the pervading wind.

original: dang po 'od gsal bar byas te //
analyzed: dang po 'od gsal bar byas te //
translated: First, it is made luminous.

original: zhes pa ni don dam pa'i man ngag bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam pa'i man ngag bsgom pa'o //
translated: This refers to the cultivation of the ultimate esoteric instruction.

original: de'i don yang dang por lte ba'i zla ba'i steng du thig le bsams te /
analyzed: de'i don yang dang por lte ba'i zla ba'i steng du thig le bsams te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: First, one imagines a drop on the moon at the navel.

original: rlung gis bskyod pa nas tha ma lus kyi ba spu la thug gi par du til gyi gang bu bzhin du gang nas bde bar gyur te /
analyzed: rlung gis bskyod pa nas tha ma lus kyi ba spu la thug gi par du til gyi gang bu bzhin du gang nas bde bar gyur te /
translated: It is filled with the wind moving up from the secret place, like a bag of sesame seeds, and bliss arises.
